channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: First minister security review call after home protest
item.description: Anti-lockdown protest branded "totally unacceptable" by former head of security for the Royal Family.

item.title: Covid case rate in Wales falls for fifth day in row
item.description: Covid case rates fall for a fifth day in a row in Wales as fully-jabbed people pass two million.

item.title: Brexit: The Walnut Tree temporarily closes because of 'staff shortage'
item.description: A well-known Welsh restaurant has temporarily closed because of a "staff shortage".

item.title: CCTV fitted as Taff's Well gardener's allotment 'sabotaged' by weed killer
item.description: Gardener David Legge fits CCTV cameras as he claims his vegetables are being targeted by vandals.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Lauren Williams wins silver in -67kg taekwondo
item.description: Great Britain's Lauren Williams takes silver in the -67kg taekwondo at Tokyo 2020 after being beaten by Matea Jelic of Croatia in the final.

item.title: Caerphilly lumberjack killed felling trees died from asphyxia, inquest hears
item.description: Ben Thomas was clearing trees from a forest when he was crushed to death in August 2017.

item.title: Wales' assistant leaves after Euro 2020 run
item.description: Arsenal assistant manager Albert Stuivenberg leaves his position as Wales assistant coach.

item.title: Weather: Thunderstorm warning issued for most of Wales
item.description: A weather warning has been issued for thunderstorms for north, mid and parts of south-west Wales.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Two in court on attempted murder charges
item.description: A 54-year-old man remains in hospital after being attacked in the Cardiff park last week.

item.title: Politician complaints double 'largely due' to Neil McEvoy
item.description: Of the 216 complaints made about Welsh politicians in 2020-21, 97 were about one man.

item.title: Universal basic income: Wales' trial 'should include everyone'
item.description: Supporters want everyone in a test area to get a fixed amount of money, regardless of income.

item.title: Catalogue of failings in cancer patient's hospital care
item.description: A 71-year-old woman died the day after being admitted to Prince Charles Hospital in Merthyr Tydfil.

item.title: Taff's Well allotments 'sabotage' leaves gardeners angry
item.description: Gardeners believe a saboteur is holding a grudge against the allotments after a spate of vandalism.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'I put too much pressure on myself' - Jade Jones on shock taekwondo exit
item.description: Two-time Olympic taekwondo champion Jade Jones discusses her shock defeat to Kimia Alizadeh of the Refugee Olympic Team in the first round of the women's -57kg tournament.

item.title: Bryn wind farm: Calls to withdraw 250m-high turbines plan
item.description: Residents fear the 250m high turbines would pose risks to wildlife, property values and health.

item.title: Holidays in Wales: How your staycation looked in 1971
item.description: The holiday camps are packed, the sun is shining and the phrase "staycation" is yet to be invented.

item.title: Cars towed for 'dangerous' parking in Snowdonia
item.description: Authorities are trying to avoid a repeat of summer 2020, when hundreds of cars obstructed roads.

item.title: Pontyclun crash: Aftermath after car hits pub, injuring six
item.description: The driver is believed to have had a "medical episode" before his car hit the pub.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Williams takes taekwondo silver for Great Britain
item.description: Great Britain's Lauren Williams takes silver in the women's -67kg taekwondo after losing the final to Croatia's Matea Jelic at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gold medals for Team GB's Adam Peaty, Tom Daley and Matty Lee, and Tom Pidcock
item.description: Day three of the Tokyo Olympics was 'Magic Monday' for Team GB with three golds - for divers Tom Daley and Matty Lee, swimmer Adam Peaty and Tom Pidcock in mountain biking.

item.title: Kevin Ellison signs new Newport County deal as Finn Azaz joins on loan
item.description: Veteran forward Kevin Ellison signs a new one-year deal with Newport County, who also sign Aston Villa midfielder Finn Azaz on loan.

item.title: Roman Walker: Glamorgan bowler to join Leicestershire
item.description: Glamorgan seam bowler Roman Walker is to join Leicestershire after three seasons in the Welsh county's first-team squad.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Mako Vunipola rejects Rassie Erasmus 'reckless' claim
item.description: Prop Mako Vunipola rejects Rassie Erasmus' suggestion that he was "dangerous" and "reckless" during the British and Irish Lions' 22-17 first Test victory in South Africa.

item.title: Galw am adolygiad o ddiogelwch Mark Drakeford yn sgil protest
item.description: Arbenigwr yn galw am adolygiad o ddiogelwch y Prif Weinidog yn dilyn protest y tu allan i'w dŷ.

item.title: Arian i Lauren Williams yn y taekwondo yn Tokyo
item.description: Y fenyw o'r Coed Duon ydy'r athletwr cyntaf o Gymru i ennill medal yng Ngemau Olympaidd Tokyo.

item.title: Torrwr coed 24 oed 'wedi ei wasgu i farwolaeth'
item.description: Cwest yn clywed bod Ben Thomas wedi mygu i farwolaeth wrth dorri coed ar lethr serth yng Nghoedwig Sirhywi.

item.title: Anabledd yn arwain at yrfa o helpu eraill yn stadiwm Liberty
item.description: Mae gan Mark Phillips Barlys yr Ymennydd ac mae'n 'profi pawb yn anghywir' yn ei yrfa gyda Chlwb Pêl-droed Abertawe

item.title: 'Y Llewod wedi dangos eu dannedd yn Cape Town'
item.description: Doedd hi ddim yn bert, ond roedd ennill y prawf cyntaf yn hollbwysig, meddai Cennydd Davies.
